name: Courtyard Lyndhurst Meadowlands

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is a standard good and comfortable hotel; but the real draw is the proximity to NYC. The NJ Transit bus stops practically right outside the door and you can get to the city in about 20 minutes for $3.40. Parking at the hotel is included with your room. The breakfast buffet is also good, plentiful, and inexpensive.
reviews.title: Great for NYC Travel

reviews.text: I have stayed at this location a couple of times for business when I work late.
reviews.title: Good Place for a Good Nights Rest.

reviews.text: It is a typical Marriott Courtyard experience. The hotel is convenience to NYC and surrounding NJ areas like the Meadowlands. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. I did not have any meals there so I cannot comment on the food.
reviews.title: Great Place Outside on New York City!

reviews.text: You need a car if you want to go out for dinner since there isn't much within walking distance.
reviews.title: Great hotel and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One potential improvement comment is regarding the check out. The front desk staff was sometimes napping in the back office so I had to wake the person up to check out. I checked out both times around 6-6:30am so this was a bit surprising.
reviews.title: Really nice place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was perfect for me and my girlfriend on New Year's. For only $142 per night on such a big NYC holiday was great. Enjoyed the city with minimal travel and much less expenses as opposed to staying in the city. If you are looking for a relatively cheap hotel with access to NYC, this is perfect for anyone.
reviews.title: Perfect for our romantic New Year's

reviews.text: It was exactly what we needed. I am very careful about places I stay; I need to be comfortable and feel safe and this hotel provided both. It is newly renovated and you can tell it is well kept when you walk in.
reviews.title: A good weekend

reviews.text: The staff was very friendly and helpful (only complaint was faulty bus information from NYC). The biggest convenience of the hotel was the bus stop (NJ transit) is right outside of the hotel on the corner of the street. Everyone who needed the bus from other hotels had to walk down to the stop, but it was right there. For $3.60 per person, the bus takes you right into Port Authority in Time Square where you can pick up the subways. (Bus ride was about 10-15 mins max).
reviews.title: Nice place with a nice view

likes.liked: — The view was lovely, and the room was incredibly comfortable.
likes.disliked: — The snafu with the reservation made my heart rate soar, and food options were limited.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room we stayed in was very nice. The view was awful (looking out the back of the hotel at a moving company headquarters), but we did not book this hotel for any views of Lyndhurst, NJ. It's a nice town and all, but nothing special. We booked the standard King Size room. It was nice and cheap. Medium sized plasma TV's, good sized bathrooms, good water pressure in shower, comfortable pillows (need a better comforter though; we had to use the extra blanket in closet which was fine.) Each room had standard hotel info in rooms, but the book provided in this one was very useful. Complimentary newspaper in the morning (should switch this to breakfast, but oh well)
reviews.title: Good hotel, terrible location

likes.liked: — Clean, well-maintained, quiet, good internet, good breakfast.
likes.disliked: — No shuttle to NY, dead end as regards public transport.

reviews.text: I did not use the pool or fitness room, but checked them out of curiosity. Pool is small but looked clean and well kept; not bad at all if you have kids. Fitness room was surprisingly nice, good size for a hotel fitness room.
reviews.title: Stayed Here off and on for a Solid Year

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel on Christmas Day because of its close proximity to family in Rutherford. When we originally booked, the hotel's website listed that the king rooms also had a pull-out couch. During check-in, we learned they did not. This was potentially a problem for my sister-in-law who was traveling with 3 children, but the hotel staff was able to upgrade her to a double bed for the same price as the king. However, they did not accomodate our request to keep our rooms together, despite several calls prior to our arrival, although they were at least able to put all of us (3 families) on the same floor.
reviews.title: A Decent Stay . . .

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were basic, but well decorated and very clean. For some reason, our phone did not work and at one point we did have trouble with our TV (we had to turn it on from the actual TV -- could not turn it on using the remote). Certainly nothing that would keep us from staying here again.
reviews.title: Friendly, helpful staff and convenient to NYC!

likes.liked: — Friendly staff, close to NYC buses!

reviews.text: Our room had a view of NYC. Given the hotel's distance from the city, it's not the best. However, my husband did wake me early the next morning to see the sunrise over NYC -- and that was beautiful!! It's no additional charge, so if you can get a city view, go for it.
reviews.title: Marriott Courtyard at Lyndhurst,NJ

reviews.text: We only stayed one day and did not use any of the facilities or the restaurant, so I cannot comment on much more, expect that my husband is always very happy to see complimentary coffee in the lobby.
reviews.title: Nice location, helpful staff

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for one night for a visit to NYC and it really exceeded my expectations. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The evening of our stay I called down to ask if they had any maps of NYC and after what seemed like a few seconds after I hung up with them there was a knock on my door from a staff member with a map for me! At check in they gave us a bus schedule and explained which buses to take. The bus stop was right outside of the hotel and was very convenient. The rooms are a bit small, but for all the more time we spend in it, it was perfect. The rooms were very clean and everything seemed fairly new. I loved having the mini-fridge in the room and the bedding was awesome! I will be sure to book this hotel for my next trip to NYC.
reviews.title: Never Again...Horrible Management!!!!

reviews.text: My wife, 6 year old, and I stayed at the Courtyard Lyndhurst for 2 nights, because of a wedding in the area. Access was very easy, just off of 17S in Lyndhurst. The facilities were well-maintained. Check-in was efficient and the staff were very friendly and accommodating. We were given a room on the first floor, not far from the indoor pool (opens at 6 am) and the 24 hour access exercise room. Overall fairly quiet, although if you want to sleep in, you might want to ask for a quieter floor- there seemed to be a fair amount of hallway traffic late at night and earlier in the morning. We were even awakened at 7 am by someone banging on our door (guest who mistook our room for their own). This hotel did seem a frequent destination for tourists, Jets/Giants fans (Meadowlands down the road) and wedding guests.
reviews.title: Great stay.

reviews.text: The room (2 queen beds, sleeper) was a good size and clean and the beds were very comfortable. There is an attached restaurant with a breakfast buffet that was acceptable and certainly very convenient.
reviews.title: great customer service, location

reviews.text: The most convenient parking was a very small lot near the lobby which frequently was full. There was an attached parking garage around the back of the hotel with plenty of parking.
reviews.title: Great stay

likes.disliked: — View of the parking garage and cemetary

reviews.text: Overall the hotel seemed very safe and secure.
reviews.title: Unprofessional Staff
Hated it.
reviews.text: Second time we have stayed here. The staff always goes out of it's way to greet you and be helpful. My son left his cell phone in the room and we called on our way back home and they went and found it in the nightstand drawer and shipped it to us FEDX!

description: Courtyard Lyndhurst/Meadowlands hotel offers stylish guest rooms with Marriott's luxury bedding, 32" LCD flat screen TV's, mini-fridge and FREE High Speed Internet. Begin your day with a reasonably priced, hot breakfast buffet and return for a delicious dinner at Reeds Restaurant. Unwind in our lounge, indoor pool or in the on-site Fitness Center. Courtyard Lyndhurst Meadowlands hotel is perfectly located close to exciting Meadowlands attractions such as the IZOD Center, Giants Stadium, Teterboro Airport (TEB), Meadowlands Racetrack, Medieval Times and just minutes to the Prudential Center in Newark. This Meadowlands hotel is also just six miles to the Lincoln Tunnel and New York City. For business or social events, our meeting rooms are ideal for your group accommodating up to 100 people. After experiencing our first class customer service, you will feel you have made the best choice at the Courtyard Lyndhurst Meadowlands hotel, one of the finest among Meadowlands hotels.
